options.content:
- Use Cases: This dashboard shows the basic Git and Code Review metrics from GitHub.
- Data Source Required: GitHub

targets.rawSql:
select 
	count(distinct i.id)
from 
	issues i
	join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
	join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
where
  $__timeFilter(i.created_date)
  and b.id in (${repo_id})

with _issues as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(i.created_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(i.created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    count(distinct i.id) as issue_count
  FROM issues i
  	join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
  	join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(i.created_date)
    -- Enable the following condition to remove the month with incomplete data
    -- and i.created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
    and b.id in (${repo_id})
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%M %Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  issue_count as "Issue Count"
FROM _issues
ORDER BY time

select 
	count(distinct i.id)
from 
	issues i
	join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
	join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
where
  $__timeFilter(i.created_date)
  and b.id in (${repo_id})
  and i.status = "DONE"

with _issues as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(i.created_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(i.created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    count(distinct case when status != 'DONE' then i.id else null end) as open_issue_count,
    count(distinct case when status = 'DONE' then i.id else null end) as closed_issue_count
  FROM issues i
    join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
    join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(i.created_date)
    -- Enable the following condition to remove the month with incomplete data
    -- and i.created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
    and b.id in (${repo_id})
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%M %Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  open_issue_count,
  closed_issue_count
FROM _issues
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 2.2 Number of open and closed issues by Issue creation time

targets.rawSql:
select 
	AVG(i.lead_time_minutes/1440) issue_lead_time_in_days
from 
	issues i
	join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
	join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
where
  $__timeFilter(i.resolution_date)
  and i.resolution_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  and b.id in (${repo_id})
  and i.status = "DONE"

panels.title: 2.3 Mean Issue Lead Time by issue resolution time

targets.rawSql:
with _issues as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(i.resolution_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(i.resolution_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    AVG(i.lead_time_minutes/1440) as issue_lead_time
  FROM issues i
  	join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
  	join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
  WHERE
    b.id in (${repo_id})
    and i.status = "DONE"
    and $__timeFilter(i.resolution_date)
    and i.resolution_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%M %Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  issue_lead_time as "Mean Issue Lead Time in Days"
FROM _issues
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 2.4 Mean issue lead time by issue resolution time

targets.rawSql:
-- Get the queue time of all outstanding bugs
with _outstanding_issues as(
  select 
    DISTINCT
    b.name as repo_name,
    i.issue_key,
    i.title,
    i.created_date,
    (TIMESTAMPDIFF(MINUTE, i.created_date,NOW()))/1440 as queue_time_in_days,
    concat(b.url,'/',i.issue_key) as url
  from 
    issues i
    left join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
    left join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
  where
    b.id in (${repo_id})
    and $__timeFilter(i.created_date)
    and i.status != 'DONE'
)

select concat('#', issue_key) as issue_key, title, url, queue_time_in_days from _outstanding_issues
order by 4 desc
limit 20

-- Get the queue time of all outstanding bugs
select 
  b.name as repo_name,
  i.issue_key as issue_key,
  i.title,
  i.created_date,
  (TIMESTAMPDIFF(MINUTE, i.created_date,NOW()))/1440 as queue_time_in_days,
  concat(b.url,'/',i.issue_key) as url
from 
  issues i
  left join board_issues bi on i.id = bi.issue_id
  left join boards b on bi.board_id = b.id
where
  b.id in (${repo_id})
  and $__timeFilter(i.created_date)
  and i.status != 'DONE'
order by queue_time_in_days desc

panels.title: 2.6 List of Outstanding Issues Order By Queue Time [All Open Issues]

targets.rawSql:
select
	count(distinct pr.id) as pull_request_count
from 
	pull_requests pr
where
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})

with _prs as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    count(distinct id) as pr_count
  FROM pull_requests
  WHERE
    base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
    and $__timeFilter(created_date)
    -- Enable the following condition to remove the month with incomplete data
    -- and created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%M %Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  pr_count as "Pull Request Count"
FROM _prs
ORDER BY time

-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
select
  author_name,
	count(distinct pr.id) as merged_pull_request_count
from 
	pull_requests pr
where
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
  and pr.status = 'MERGED'
group by 1
order by 2 desc
limit 20

-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
select
  count(distinct case when status = 'CLOSED' then id else null end)/count(distinct case when status in ('CLOSED', 'MERGED') then id else null end) as ratio
from 
	pull_requests pr
where
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})

panels.title: 4.1 Ratio of unmerged PRs of All Closed PRs

targets.rawSql:
-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
with _prs as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    count(distinct case when status = 'OPEN' then id else null end) as open,
    count(distinct case when status = 'CLOSED' then id else null end) as closed,
    count(distinct case when status = 'MERGED' then id else null end) as merged
  FROM pull_requests
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(created_date)
    -- Enable the following condition to remove the month with incomplete data
    -- and created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
    and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%M %Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  open as "PR: Open",
  closed as "PR: Closed without merging",
  merged as "PR: Closed and merged"
FROM _prs
ORDER BY time

-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
select
	count(distinct pr.id) as merged_pull_request_count
from 
	pull_requests pr
where
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
	and pr.status = 'CLOSED'

panels.title: 4.3 Number of PRs Closed without Merging

targets.rawSql:
-- The PR/MR statuses are standardized to DevLake's statuses 'OPEN', 'MERGED' and 'CLOSED'. You can check out the original status from the field `original_status`
SELECT
  DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
  count(distinct case when status = 'CLOSED' then id else null end)/count(distinct case when status in ('CLOSED', 'MERGED') then id else null end) as ratio
FROM pull_requests
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
  and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
group by 1

panels.title: 4.4 Ratio of unmerged PRs of All Closed PRs

targets.rawSql:
select
	avg(TIMESTAMPDIFF(Minute,created_date,merged_date)/1440)
from 
	pull_requests
where 
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
	and merged_date is not null

panels.title: 4.5 Mean Time to Merge of Pull Requests

targets.rawSql:
with _prs as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    avg(TIMESTAMPDIFF(Minute,created_date,merged_date)/1440) as time_to_merge
  FROM pull_requests
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(created_date)
    -- Enable the following condition to remove the month with incomplete data
    -- and created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
    and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%M %Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  time_to_merge as "Time to Merge"
FROM _prs
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 4.6 Mean Time to Merge of Pull Requests in Days

targets.rawSql:
select
	avg(TIMESTAMPDIFF(Minute,created_date,closed_date)/1440) as time_to_close
from 
	pull_requests
where 
  $__timeFilter(created_date)
	and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
	and status in ('CLOSED', 'MERGED')

panels.title: 4.7 Mean Time to Close of Pull Requests in Days

targets.rawSql:
with _prs as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(created_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(created_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    avg(TIMESTAMPDIFF(Minute,created_date,closed_date)/1440) as time_to_close
  FROM pull_requests
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(created_date)
    -- Enable the following condition to remove the month with incomplete data
    -- and created_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
    and base_repo_id in (${repo_id})
    and status in ('CLOSED', 'MERGED')
  group by 1
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%M %Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  time_to_close as "Time to Close"
FROM _prs
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 4.8 Mean Time to Close of Pull Requests in Days

panels.description: Number of workflow runs executed in the selected time range

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  count(distinct id)
FROM 
  cicd_pipelines
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(finished_date)
  and result = 'SUCCESS'
  and id like "%github%"
  and cicd_scope_id in (${repo_id})
  -- the following condition will remove the month with incomplete data
  and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)

panels.title: 5.1 Total Number of Successful workflow runs

panels.description: Number of successful workflow runs / Number of total workflow runs

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  1.0 * count(case when result = 'SUCCESS' then id else null end)/count(distinct id)
FROM cicd_pipelines
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(finished_date)
  and id like "%github%"
  and cicd_scope_id in (${repo_id})
  -- the following condition will remove the month with incomplete data
  and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)

panels.title: 5.2 Mean Workflow Runs Success Rate

targets.rawSql:
with _workflow_runs as (
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(finished_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(finished_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    count(distinct case when result = 'SUCCESS' then id else null end) as successful_workflow_run_count,
    count(distinct case when result != 'SUCCESS' then id else null end) as failed_workflow_run_count
  FROM cicd_pipelines
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(finished_date)
    and id like "%github%"
    and cicd_scope_id in (${repo_id})
    -- Enable the following condition to remove the month with incomplete data
    -- and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  GROUP BY 1
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%M %Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  successful_workflow_run_count,
  failed_workflow_run_count
FROM _workflow_runs
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 5.3 Number of successful and failed workflow runs

panels.description: Number of successful workflow runs / Number of total workflow runs

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  IF(result = '', 'Unknown', result) as result,
  count(distinct id) as build_count
FROM cicd_pipelines
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(finished_date)
  and id like "%github%"
  and cicd_scope_id in (${repo_id})
  -- the following condition will remove the month with incomplete data
  and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
GROUP BY 1
ORDER BY 2 desc

panels.title: 5.4 Total Workflow Runs Result Distribution

panels.description:
1. Mean Workflow Runs success rate over time.
2. The workflow runs being calculated are filtered by "workflow runs starting time" (time filter at the upper-right corner) and "Jira board" ("Choose Board" filter at the upper-left corner)

targets.rawSql:
WITH _build_success_rate as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(finished_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(finished_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    result,
    id
  FROM
    cicd_pipelines
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(finished_date)
    and id like "%github%"
    and cicd_scope_id in (${repo_id})
    -- Enable the following condition to remove the month with incomplete data
    -- and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  GROUP BY 
    time, result, id
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%m/%Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  1.0 * sum(case when result = 'SUCCESS' then 1 else 0 end)/ count(*) as "Workflow Runs Success Rate"
FROM _build_success_rate
GROUP BY time
ORDER BY time

panels.title: 5.5 Workflow Runs Success Rate

panels.description: Number of successful workflow runs / Number of total workflow runs

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  avg(duration_sec/60) as duration_in_minutes
FROM cicd_pipelines
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(finished_date)
  and id like "%github%"
  and cicd_scope_id in (${repo_id})
  -- the following condition will remove the month with incomplete data
  and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)

panels.title: 5.6 Mean Workflow Runs Duration

targets.rawSql:
WITH _builds as(
  SELECT
    DATE_ADD(date(finished_date), INTERVAL -$interval(date(finished_date))+1 DAY) as time,
    avg(duration_sec) as mean_duration_sec
  FROM 
    cicd_pipelines
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(finished_date)
    and id like "%github%"
    and cicd_scope_id in (${repo_id})
    -- Enable the following condition to remove the month with incomplete data
    -- and finished_date >= DATE_ADD(DATE_ADD($__timeFrom(), INTERVAL -DAY($__timeFrom())+1 DAY), INTERVAL +1 MONTH)
  GROUP BY 1
)

SELECT 
  case when '$interval' = 'DAYOFMONTH' then date_format(time,'%M %Y') else concat('W', date_format(time,'%u %Y')) end as _time,
  mean_duration_sec
FROM _builds
ORDER BY time

options.content: This dashboard is created based on this [data schema](https://devlake.apache.org/docs/DataModels/DevLakeDomainLayerSchema). Want to add more metrics? Please follow the [guide](https://devlake.apache.org/docs/Configuration/Dashboards/GrafanaUserGuide).

list.definition: select concat(name, '--', id) as text from repos where id like 'github%'
list.label: Repo
list.name: repo_id
list.query: select concat(name, '--', id) as text from repos where id like 'github%'
